solution.text:
Area of the track=area of the semicircular path + area of the parallel path
Area of the semicircular path=\( 2\times [\frac 12 \times \pi \times (2r)^2- \frac 12 \times \pi \times (r)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(3*pi_val*k*k,2)}}_\)
We can see, parallel path is in arectangular shape with length=4r and breadth=r
area of the parallel path=\(2\times [(4r)\times (r)]\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{2*4*k*k}}_\)
So, area of the track=_{{trunc(3*pi_val*k*k,2)+2*4*k*k}}_\(m^2\)
Cost to build the track=\(_{{trunc(3*pi_val*k*k,2)+2*4*k*k}}_\times _{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow Rs. _{{(trunc(3*pi_val*k*k,2)+2*4*k*k)*j}}_\)

content.text:
Calculate the cost to build a track at a rate of Rs_{j}_per \(m^2\)
The shape and dimensions of the track are given in the figure.(r=_{k}_metres)
